qas.question: Whose name is on the permit required for operation of an elevator?
Do all jurisdictions require the permit to be displayed in the elevator?

answers.text: some jurisdictions require the permit to be displayed in the elevator cab, other jurisdictions allow for the operating permit to be kept on file elsewhere

qas.question: Aside from the elevator, where else might a permit be displayed?
What type of notice can be displayed in the elevator in lieu of the permit?

answers.text: a notice is posted in its place informing riders of where the actual permits are kept.

context: Most elevators have a location in which the permit for <a0_0>the building owner<a0_0/> to operate the elevator is displayed. While <a1_0>some jurisdictions require the permit to be displayed in the elevator cab, other jurisdictions allow for the operating permit to be kept on file elsewhere<a1_0/> – such as <a2_0>the maintenance office<a2_0/> – and to be made available for inspection on demand. In such cases instead of the permit being displayed in the elevator cab, often <a3_0>a notice is posted in its place informing riders of where the actual permits are kept.
